questions.question: Considering the overall presentation, what is the primary textual element depicted on the product?
What is the background color of the rectangular label featuring the product's listed components?
Focusing on the textual layout, what is the style of the typeface used to display the product composition?
Disregarding any abbreviations, what is the first prominently displayed ingredient listed?
What is the second prominent ingredient listed in the sequence of components?
What is the last item among the ingredients explicitly mentioned on the label?
Inspecting the text closely, what is the name of the plant whose extract is listed?
Among the various ingredients, what oil is specifically identified and listed?
In terms of formatting, what punctuation is used to separate the ingredients in the list?
What is the word preceding the parenthetical clarification for the first ingredient?
What is the word used to introduce the list of components?
What is the general shape of the area where the text is visibly printed?
What is the overall arrangement or organization of the textual content?
What is the case (upper or lower) of the word 'Ingredients'?
Disregarding any scientific names, what common name is used for an ingredient?
